name: When My Soul Dreams
description:
When My Soul Dreams represents my journey into the unknown, By unknown I mean no planning or premeditation went into producing this triptych piece. I simply abandoned myself to the creative process and allowed my intuition to lead the way. There's no beginning, no end, no narrative no message; just reflections of my inner-minds voice when I am free.

Her spirit comes from within and flourishes in all the colours of the rainbow. She has loved, she has lost and she has found herself again. No hardships can hold her down for she is a phenomenal woman phenomenally.

name: A Tomorrow of Hope
description:
"A Tomorrow of HOPE" was inspired by two quotes that resonated with me from OBama's many memorable speeches. 

First Quote: "We all have a stake in one another whether we realize it or not"
Second Quote: "That which binds us together is greater than that which drives us apart"

These quotes served as the over-arching theme for my piece. It personifies the idea that our fates are inter-connected and as such we need to commit ourselves to become "My Brother's Keeper and My Sister's Keeper". We finally have a gifted, bright leader on the world stage for another 4 more years who will continue to inspire and galvanize the everyday person with a renewed sense of citizenship to rally around a common purpose for a better tomorrow...."A Tomorrow of HOPE".

JasonOBrienGallery.COM has now released only 44 limited edition prints of this image to commemorate the fact that Obama is the 44th President of the United States of America. After the 44 prints there will be no more.

name: Heaven Is Not Hard To Find
description:
"Heaven Is Not Hard To Find" depicts a woman who reconnects again to what she thought was lost. By embracing her strengths and faults she expresses a new brand of self-love not felt before. Often times we turn to material things to artificially define our self-worth, but if you stop to realize that "Heaven is Not Hard to Find"...you too will see that you always had everything you will ever need.

name: Black Cotton
description:

description:

Yet in the spirit of resilience embodied by most women, she forgives and allows her heart to be vulnerable to love again because in a world with much pain and suffering, we could all use more Cherry’s Hearts.

name: Acrobats Looking for Balance (Original)
description: "Acrobats Looking For Balance" was my exploration in to the world of abstract expressionism. It was fueled by my anxiety for risk-taking and the excitement of decoding a new visual language that allowed me to express my creative mind-state. This painting was inspired by the thought of graphic shapes and textures leaping across the canvas like acrobats unbound by definitions of reality. In painting this piece the physical relationship of the shapes is constantly tested by my need to control and construct the painting while still embracing forces of chance and spontaneity, inturn they are always "Looking for Balance.
